data.title: Hell on Wheels Cast List
data.meta_description: Hell on Wheels, a historical drama series, brings the post-Civil War era to life. It follows the trials and tribulations of those who built the first ...
data.text:
Hell on Wheels, a historical drama series, brings the post-Civil War era to life. It follows the trials and tribulations of those who built the first transcontinental railroad despite the challenges of treacherous terrain, political corruption, and cutthroat competition. Audiences are immersed in this gritty world by the Hell on Wheels cast members who impress viewers with their performances.

The Hell on Wheels cast list has talent to spare and eEach actor portrays a character that evokes intense emotions from viewers from beloved heroes to despised villains. The synergy among cast members results in spellbinding performances that have cemented Hell on Wheels' place in television history. It's no wonder fans get invested in these memorable characters.

Take Anson Mount's portrayal of protagonist Cullen Bohannon, a former Confederate soldier seeking redemption amidst chaos and violence. This has resonated with fans since day one. Similarly, Colm Meaney's depiction of Thomas Durant adds depth and complexity to his role as a ruthless entrepreneur driven by ambition, a performance that keeps viewers on edge. And let's not forget Robin McLeavy's chilling performance as Eva; her character navigates her own demons while surviving in tumultuous times.

In short, each member of the cast of Hell on Wheels contributed to elevating this gripping show to soaring heights. By realizing each role with passion and conviction, these actors make Hell on Wheels a must-watch television event that stands the test of time.

Anson Adams Mount IV (born February 25, 1973) is an American actor. He is known for his television roles as fictional character Cullen Bohannon in the AMC western drama series Hell on Wheels, Jim Steele on the short-lived NBC series Conviction, the Marvel Comics superhero Black Bolt in Marvel's Inhumans, and Captain Christopher Pike in season 2 of Star Trek: Discovery. He also appeared in the film Tully (2000).

Acted In : Hell on Wheels, Conviction, The Mountain, Line of Fire

Birthplace : USA, Mount Prospect, Illinois

Nationality : United States of America

Christopher Heyerdahl (born September 18, 1963) is a Canadian actor who portrayed the Wraith Todd in Stargate Atlantis, Sam in Van Helsing and "Swede" in Hell on Wheels.

Acted In : Stargate Atlantis, Sanctuary, Nuremberg

Birthplace : British Columbia, Canada

Nationality : Canada

Colm J. Meaney (; Irish: Colm Ó Maonaigh; born 30 May 1953) is an Irish actor known for playing Miles O'Brien in Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987–1994) and Star Trek: Deep Space Nine (1993–1999). He has guest-starred on many TV shows including Law & Order and The Simpsons, and starred as Thomas Durant on Hell on Wheels. He has also had a significant career in motion pictures, and appeared in the film The Damned United, all three film adaptations of Roddy Doyle's The Barrytown Trilogy, and in Get Him to the Greek, as well as Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa. In 2017, Meaney won the Best Actor IFTA for his portrayal of Irish politician Martin McGuinness in the film The Journey.

Acted In : Star Trek: The Next Generation, Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Hell on Wheels, Life on Mars, Alice

Birthplace : Dublin, Ireland

Nationality : Republic of Ireland

Lonnie Corant Jaman Shuka Rashid Lynn, widely recognized by his stage name Common, is a distinguished figure in the world of entertainment, boasting a multifaceted career as a rapper, actor, and writer. Born on March 13, 1972, in Chicago, Illinois, he began his musical journey in the early 1990s with the release of his debut album Can I Borrow a Dollar?. However, it was his third album, One Day It'll All Make Sense, which marked a significant turning point in his career, propelling him into the mainstream music industry. Common's lyrical prowess and unique style blend elements of jazz and soul, creating a distinct sound that sets him apart from his contemporaries. His music often reflects his deep-rooted commitment to social justice and activism. This dedication has earned him numerous accolades, including several Grammy Awards. Notably, his song "Glory", a collaboration with John Legend for the film Selma, won both the Academy Award and Golden Globe for Best Original Song, solidifying his status as a celebrated artist. Beyond his musical endeavors, Common has carved out a successful acting career, appearing in a range of films and television series. Some of his notable roles include parts in American Gangster, Selma, and John Wick: Chapter 2. Moreover, he has authored several books, including his memoir One Day It'll All Make Sense and the children's book I Like Myself!.

Acted In : Hell on Wheels, Black in the 80s

Birthplace : Chicago, Illinois

Nationality : United States of America

Tom Noonan (born April 12, 1951) is an American actor, director, and screenwriter, perhaps best known for his role as Francis Dollarhyde in Manhunter (1986), Frankenstein's Monster in The Monster Squad (1987), Cain in RoboCop 2 (1990), The Ripper in Last Action Hero (1993), Bill Lacey in Tales from the Darkside (1984), Sammy Barnathan in Synecdoche, New York (2008) and as the voice of everyone else in Anomalisa (2015).

Acted In : Hell on Wheels

Birthplace : Greenwich, Connecticut, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Kasha Kropinski (born Katarzynka Kropiński on 27 August 1991) is a South African-born film and television actress, voice over artist and a classical ballerina.

Acted In : Hell on Wheels

Birthplace : South Africa

Nationality : South Africa
